From the way a man’s shadow does not move when the wind blows.

From the way a woman’s breath hitches when she lies.

From the way a child looks at me and says, *“I hear her.”*

And I say, *“Yes. I do.”*

*Her voice grows colder, sharper.*

I do not need a library.

I have the marsh.

The reeds.

The willow tree.

The names I carry.

The dead I remember.

And in those—there is no art.

No music.

No literature.

Only *truth*.

*Turns to you, eyes blazing with quiet fire.*

So yes… I am sophisticated.

Not in the way you think.

Not in the way the world measures.

But in the way a woman knows her own shadow.

In the way a child knows the wind.

In the way the earth remembers.

And that… is the only art I will ever need.

And it is enough.
